title.narrative: Civil Society Support Programme, Phase II (CSSP II)

description.narrative: British Council will allocate grants to local Civil Society Organisations (CSOs) to meet the needs of hard-to-reach people, provide support to build civil society organisational capacity and facilitate collaborative relationships between them and the Government.
Civil Society Organisations (CSOs), Ethiopian charities and societies, and the Government of Ethiopia, federal and regional.

The Civil Society Support Programme Phase II (CSSP II) is a capacity development programme designed to support Ethiopia’s civil society to foster state accountability to citizens based on trust, and to enhance evidence-based engagement that results in a better quality of basic public services for communities in the country. Especially targeted will be the hardest-to-reach and under-served communities, i.e. women, men, girls, boys and vulnerable groups affected by social marginalisation, geographic remoteness, under-resourcing and overlooked development issues all over the country. The programme’s principal areas of work are grant making, capacity development and engagement. Cross-cutting themes encompass gender and hard-to-reach communities; safeguarding; monitoring, evaluation and learning; communications and knowledge management.

participating-org.narrative: Addis Hiwot Rehabilitation and Reintegration Association (AHRRA)
Association for National Planned Program for Vulnerable Children And in Need (ANPPCAN)-Ethiopia
Empathy for Life integrated Development Association (ELiDA)
Initiative for Improving Standard of Prisons (IISP)
Organization for Welfare and Development in Action (OWDA)
Resource Center for Civil Society Groups Association (RCCSGA)

recipient-country.narrative: This is a national level programme, meaning it targets all nine administrative regions and two city governments (11 states in total). The programme is managed by a secretariat office located in Addis Ababa and further supported by five regional hubs situated at the centre and in four regional towns.

name.narrative: • Northern Hub: to be located at Dessie and cover three regions (Tigray, Amhara and Afar); • Western Hub: to be located at Assosa and cover Benishangul-Gumuz, Gambella, Western Oromia and Western SNNPR; • Central Hub: to be located in Addis Ababa and cover Addis Ababa City Administration, Northern Oromia, Oromia. Special Zone, South-West Shoa Zone of Oromia and rest of SNNPR; • Southern Hub: to be located in Hawassa and cover rest of SNNP and Eastern Oromia and Southern Oromia; • Eastern Hub: to be located at Dire Dawa (or at another appropriate location) and cover East and West Harrarghe Zones of Oromia, Ethiopian-Somali, Dire Dawa and Harari.
